intro: Dysoxylum minutiflorum var. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-flowered dysoxylum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a small, smooth, yellowish drupe that contains a single seed.
